intro: Lepidosperma lineare, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sedgeland, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in wetland environments and is often found in marshes and swamps. Lepidosperma lineare plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
